intro: Leucas urticifolia, commonly known as the stinging nettle plant, is a herbaceous perennial belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely toothed, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, which can cause an irritating rash upon contact. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Leucas urticifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
